title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

previous.title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

next.title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

content:
When Rubin Observatory first discovers an asteroid, its orbit around the Sun is not well defined. Astronomers can calculate possible different orbits of the asteroid by considering the set of orbits that can fit the measured positions.

The pink region contains the possible orbits of the asteroid based on the first two observations.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Look at the possible orbits for this asteroid from different angles. Do you think this asteroid could hit Earth (in other words, do any of the possible orbits for the asteroid cross Earthâ€™s orbit)? Explain your reasoning.
